description.plain:
Foo Fighters are an American rock band formed in 1995 by ex-Nirvana drummer Dave Grohl. Originally a solo project by Grohl to overcome the grief of Kurt Cobain’s death, Grohl attracted label interest with his inaugural demo tape. He then decided to recruit a full band to perform the songs live.

The band has achieved mainstream success in the rock world, releasing several highly acclaimed albums and singles.

Fun Fact: According to Dave Grohl, the Foo Fighters‘ band name is named after the UFOs that were reported by Allied aircraft pilots in World War II.

I was reading a lot of books on UFO’s. Not only is it a fascinating subject, but there’s a treasure trove of band names in those UFO books! So, since I had recorded the first record by myself, playing all the instruments, but I wanted people to think that it was a group, I figured that FOO FIGHTERS might lead people to believe that it was more than just one guy. Silly, huh?

Fun Fact: According to Dave Grohl, the Foo Fighters‘ band name is named after the UFOs that were reported by Allied aircraft pilots in World War II.

I was reading a lot of books on UFO’s. Not only is it a fascinating subject, but there’s a treasure trove of band names in those UFO books! So, since I had recorded the first record by myself, playing all the instruments, but I wanted people to think that it was a group, I figured that FOO FIGHTERS might lead people to believe that it was more than just one guy. Silly, huh?

description.plain:
The second single from 1997’s The Colour and the Shape. “Everlong” was penned by Dave Grohl during his split with his first wife, photographer Jennifer Youngblood.

The divorce left him alone, and essentially homeless since she kicked him out of the house. To add insult to injury, the Foo Fighters weren’t doing as well as he envisioned, and his fellow band members were close to quitting. Right as he was about to bottom out, he returned home to Virginia for Christmas 1996 and wrote down the lyrics to this simple little ballad about falling in love with a new woman in a span of 45 minutes. It did well enough to keep the band together and get his life back on track. In Grohl’s words:

That song’s about a girl that I’d fallen in love with and it was basically about being connected to someone so much, that not only do you love them physically and spiritually, but when you sing along with them you harmonize perfectly.

The song has since been immortalized by Grohl’s stripped down and emotional live renditions. It usually finishes concerts (especially because its heartfelt tone contrasts too much with the rest of the setlist).

It is notable for being famous talk show host David Letterman’s favorite song, to the point where FF rescheduled their tour to play on his first show back from heart surgery, and was the last song played on the very last show Letterman hosted before retiring.

It was featured in the rhythm games Guitar Hero: World Tour and Rock Band 2, both released in 2008.

songs.full_title: The Sky Is a Neighborhood by Foo Fighters

description.plain:
“The Sky Is A Neighborhood,” a track about life’s hardships, is the second single release from their 2017 album, Concrete and Gold.

Prior to its official release, it was performed in May 2017 at an Acoustic 4 A Cure charity show in San Francisco, which benefitted UCSF Benioff Children’s Hospital’s pediatric cancer wing. Frontman Dave Grohl introduced the song, saying:

I figured on the way up here, I thought, ‘Fuck it, let’s play a new song, man, let’s do something nobody’s heard.’ We’ve never played this song in front of anybody.

annotatable.title: The Sky Is a Neighborhood
annotatable.link_title: The Sky Is a Neighborhood by Foo Fighters

description.plain:
“Run” tells of an escape from a dream-like stupor with vaguely political themes. It is unique among Foo Fighters music in that it has a heavier sound than the norm.

The track marks the band’s first piece of music to be released since their brief ‘indefinite hiatus’ after their 2015 EP Saint Cecilia.

“Run” was released on June 1, 2017 with a video clip featuring the band in old age make-up running amok in an oppressive retirement home. It was directed by Dave Grohl.



“Run” won a Grammy Award for Best Rock Song at the 2018 Grammys held on Jan. 28, 2018.

songs.full_title: Best of You by Foo Fighters

description.plain:
This is a record that had half the world turning up their stereos and bouncing around the room, as Dave Grohl inspires us to do better. The word “best” is repeated over 40 times in this manic four minutes. But there aren’t enough superlatives available to describe the feeling in your stomach when the first few words are sung.



And yet while it became an anthem, once the band did their first version they put it away, feeling it was not up to their standards. Then manager John  Silva felt its absence, and they were forced to do some more work on it.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VCmi_xLoH7Q

Dave said the song had inspiration from playing in the John Kerry presidential campaign, “so I started writing all these songs about breaking away from the things that confine you. ”

songs.full_title: All My Life by Foo Fighters
songs.embed_content: Read “All My Life” by Foo Fighters on Genius

description.plain:
“All My Life” is a song by the American alternative rock band Foo Fighters, released as the first single from their fourth album, One by One.

Dave Grohl said that the song was quite sexual in nature. He told Q Magazine “That song is a little dirty. I’m very fond of giving oral sex to women…” He also noted that the band had wanted a heavier sounding song to appear as a single.

The song won a Grammy Award for Best Hard Rock Performance and spent ten straight weeks at #1 on the Hot Rock chart.

annotatable.title: All My Life

songs.embed_content: Read “My Hero” by Foo Fighters on Genius

description.plain:
Grohl has claimed he didn’t have any rockstar rolemodels growing up. This song is a tribute to those he did look up to: the everyday people.
The sentiment on this track is simple. You don’t have to be rich, or famous or successful to do something good or heroic.
As with many Foo Fighters songs, fans have tried to appropriate the lyrics to Nirvana frontman, Kurt Cobain, but Dave insists that they refer only to the average man on the street. Whatever the case may be, “My Hero” was still a top 10 rock smash.

songs.full_title: Learn to Fly by Foo Fighters
songs.embed_content: Read “Learn to Fly” by Foo Fighters on Genius

description.plain:
In Dave Grohl’s own words:

[“Learn to Fly” is] about the search for some sort of inspiration, the search for signs of life that will make you feel alive. It’s actually one of my least favourite songs on the record.

Musically, “Learn To Fly” is a little less loud than some of the band’s back catalog, and the chorus is more catchy than crazy. The track peaked at #19 on *Billboard charts, and it was #1 overall on Billboard’s Hot Alternative Songs list.

The drug-induced disaster flight of a video is probably as famous as the song it accompanies. It won the Grammy Award for “Best Short Form Music Video” in 2001.  The many faces of the band and the Tenacious D cameo are in-flight entertainment at its best.

annotatable.title: Learn to Fly

[“Learn to Fly” is] about the search for some sort of inspiration, the search for signs of life that will make you feel alive. It’s actually one of my least favourite songs on the record.

Musically, “Learn To Fly” is a little less loud than some of the band’s back catalog, and the chorus is more catchy than crazy. The track peaked at #19 on *Billboard charts, and it was #1 overall on Billboard’s Hot Alternative Songs list.

The drug-induced disaster flight of a video is probably as famous as the song it accompanies. It won the Grammy Award for “Best Short Form Music Video” in 2001.  The many faces of the band and the Tenacious D cameo are in-flight entertainment at its best.

description.plain: “Walk” was the final track and second single off of the Foo Fighters‘ 2011 album Wasting Light. It deals with the themes of starting over and overcoming obstacles. It reached Number 1 on the Billboard Rock Song chart, and was nominated for Best Rock Performance and Best Rock Song.

This song is about not wanting to be someone’s foolish person/someone who can be manipulated.

description.plain:
“Big Me” is a heartfelt ballad written for Dave Grohl’s first wife, Jennifer Youngblood.

It’s best remembered for the music video spoofing Mentos commercials, which Grohl felt it fit as “Big Me” is “this short, tongue-in-cheek, ridiculously candy-coated pop tune”. The video’s success made the band stop playing it for 10 years, given fans would throw Mentos and it felt like a stoning as “Those little … things are like pebbles — they hurt.”

songs.full_title: Times Like These by Foo Fighters
songs.embed_content: Read “Times Like These” by Foo Fighters on Genius

description.plain: “Times Like These” is the second single off One By One, and a song with much symbolism regarding that album’s production. After the early unsuccessful recording sessions, Dave Grohl decided the band had to take a break, and accepted an invitation to play drums for Queens of the Stone Age. However, at a certain point he missed the Foo Fighters, and wrote “Times Like These” to express how “the band disappearing for those two or three months and me feeling like I wasn’t entirely myself.” It was the first of three new compositions brought to the re-recording of One by One in Grohl’s Virginia home studio, along with “Low” and “Disenchanted Lullaby”.

“Arrows” is Concrete and Gold seventh track. As Dave Grohl said:

It happened at the perfect time. I was inspired by what was going on with our country—politically, personally, as a father, an American and a musician. There was a lot to write about.

So, the song could talk about a refugee, as she

Had arrows in her eyes
Fear where her heart should be
War in her mind

description.plain: “La Dee Da” is littered with references to obscure racist and neo-nazist bands. In a recent interview, Grohl was at pains to explain that the song reconnects with both his own alienated teen self and other alienated young males he knew. You get the feeling it’s loosely about the embittered testosterone fuelling current US politics.

songs.embed_content: Read “Dirty Water” by Foo Fighters on Genius

description.plain:
“Dirty Water” describes an alternate story where a natural disaster occurred and has tarnished the water supply, making it dirty. The mornings after the earthquakes and storms are always peaceful, creating hope for the future.

Dave alludes himself to being a natural disaster and constantly drinks dirty water because of his negative emotions. Only someone special in his life can cheer him up.

Concrete and Gold subtlety discusses the chaos of politics in America, and one of the concerns that everyone is talking about is climate change. Natural disasters are the result of climate change according to most scientists. But some political figures object to it. Dave labels himself as a citizen terribly affected by these political figures and their decisions.

songs.full_title: Something from Nothing by Foo Fighters
songs.embed_content: Read “Something from Nothing” by Foo Fighters on Genius

description.plain:
Jumpy and unpredictable, “Something From Nothing” is the opening track on the Foo Fighter’s eighth studio album, Sonic Highways, an ambitious project made in conjunction with a companion documentary series that serves as a tribute to American music.

The very first stop on the band’s musical journey across America is the windy city, Chicago, Illinois. The birthplace of modern blues music, with Muddy Waters and Buddy Guy proud to call the city home, and a cradle for punk rock with Chicagoans Steve Albini and Rick Nielsen (from Cheap Trick, and a guest musician playing the baritone guitar in this track), Chicago’s music scene served as the ultimate inspiration for Dave Grohl’s vision for Sonic Highways:

One thing I’ve realized about talking to all these people is that we’ve all made something from nothing. It’s that fire, or that inspiration, that moves you through life.



Butch Vig said that he was worried about tracking Something From Nothing, because it’s a really complex song. For the Foo Fighters, it’s also really a new feel. The song is kinda groovy and they’re, according to Taylor Hawkins, “not really, like, the groovy band”.

annotatable.title: Something from Nothing
annotatable.link_title: Something from Nothing by Foo Fighters

One thing I’ve realized about talking to all these people is that we’ve all made something from nothing. It’s that fire, or that inspiration, that moves you through life.



Butch Vig said that he was worried about tracking Something From Nothing, because it’s a really complex song. For the Foo Fighters, it’s also really a new feel. The song is kinda groovy and they’re, according to Taylor Hawkins, “not really, like, the groovy band”.

songs.embed_content: Read “T-Shirt” by Foo Fighters on Genius

description.plain:
Dave Grohl has stated

I’m not an outwardly political person. But it’s pretty easy to figure out where I fall on the map.

This song, written shortly after Donald Trump’s inauguration, shows some of his concerns:

I watched the infamous press conference in the East Room – the one that turned into a screaming match. The fucking WWE one. All that gross ambition for power and control freaked me out. I was like, ‘Oh, my God. This is what we’ve become.’

A little alone?
A little exhausted?
Do you give it away?
Do you let go?
How do you find it?
A little afraid?
A little alone?
A little exhausted?
Do you give it away?
Do you let go?
Oh
songs.embed_content: Read “Sunday Rain” by Foo Fighters on Genius

description.plain:
For the second time, drummer Taylor Hawkins takes over lead vocals in a Foo Fighters original. And his replacement in the percussion is a heavyweight: Sir Paul McCartney, who has become a friend of Dave Grohl and said that

Even if it had been banjo, I think I probably would have showed up.

Even if drums aren’t his primary instrument, both Grohl and Hawkins complimented Paul’s performance.

body.plain:
For the second time, drummer Taylor Hawkins takes over lead vocals in a Foo Fighters original. And his replacement in the percussion is a heavyweight: Sir Paul McCartney, who has become a friend of Dave Grohl and said that

Even if it had been banjo, I think I probably would have showed up.

Even if drums aren’t his primary instrument, both Grohl and Hawkins complimented Paul’s performance.

songs.title: Sunday Rain
